title: Global Communications Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at FINCA International (Washington, DC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The process was very thorough but moved along quickly. I was very impressed by how well planned and well organized the entire process and each step of it was along the way. Communications from HR and from the department hiring manager were excellent (they always kept in touch and kept me informed, and they were always very thoughtful and courteous).

I was initially contacted by the head of global recruiting and she conducted a telephone interview with me. She asked very interesting, intelligent, and relevant questions (not the silly old-school hiring questions) that really got to the heart of what it would take to do the job and also to fit into the FINCA culture. We spoke at least two languages during the interview! (That was not a requirement, but it was a flavor of the wonderful, global nature of the organization.) Speaking with the global recruiting director impressed me greatly and spoke volumes about the high quality of staff and the culture at FINCA. Off to a good start!

Shortly after that phone conversation (I think a matter of days), I was contacted by the department hiring manager. We talked at length (about one hour). Within a couple of days I was asked to provide work samples and then to respond to five questions that required a fair amount of research and writing. 

After my work/presentation was reviewed, I was advanced in the process and invited to participate in person for a panel interview with three of the organization's senior executives. I also had the chance to meet the CEO at the end of the panel interview. 

I received an offer shortly after the panel interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my perception of the sector and the relative position of FINCA and its peers

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at FINCA International
Interview Descriptions: The administrative staff are all very friendly. There's a strong emphasis on being "business-like" and "bank-like". The culture lacks that passion for mission-driven work that many other non-profits have. The initial interview was a small group interview led by an employee and joined by a consultant. The second and final interview was with the department's VP. The interview process varies depending on the position. For very senior jobs, there are more rounds of interviews.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were very standard questions. There were no technical questions (although the interview was for a technical position), there were no behavioral questions or anything else. Just questions like, "Why do you want this job?", "Why FINCA?", and "Tell me about yourself." The most unusual question was regarding how I managed and prioritized tasks and projects. I answered that I use the Franklin Covey planning system as I once attended the FC Achieving Your Highest Priorities one-day workshop. That was the "right" answer. FINCA has historically preferred that employees use the FC system, although many employees don't.
